prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: HDO
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Our aim is to detect water isotopologue HDO together with other molecules in order to put D/H ratio estimate into context.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Assuming the minimun thershold for TOO observations (Comet with Q/Delta >= 2e29) the faintest line we aim at is HDO at 464.9GHz with an integrated line flux of 50mJykm/s in a 2km/s line width. We require a sensitivity of 2mJy in 3km/s channel to reach a reasonable signal to noise ratio of 9 in 2h on source. see table below for all numbers
The estimations are made assuming a rather compact configuration C43-2 which creates a flux loss of 30% due to short spacing filtering. More compact configuration corresponds to higher SNR ratio, more extended to slightly lower values.
As we observe very narrow lines, we ask for a small channel spacing. When possible we plan to use only a fraction of the baseband to reduce the data rate. We reach a value close to 12MB/s.
\hline HDO & $6\times10^{25}$ & 101--000 & 464.925 & 0.050 & 3h & 9 & 0.0033 \\ CH$_3$OH & $5\times10^{27}$ & $9_2-9_1A^{+-}$ & 464.834 & 0.19 & 3h & 29 & 0.0033 \\ CH$_3$OH & $5\times10^{27}$ & $8_2-8_1A^{+-}$ & 468.294 & 0.25 & 3h & 39 & 0.0033 \\
CH$_3$OH & $5\times10^{27}$ & $6_{+1}-5_0E$ & 455.618 & 0.27 & 3h & 23 & 0.006 \\ H$_2$S & $1\times10^{27}$ & 111--000 & 452.390 & 0.44 & 3h & 20 & 0.011 \\ HNC & $1\times10^{25}$ & 5--4 & 453.270 & 0.14 & 3h & 8 & 0.008 \\ \hline

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: HCN,HC15N,H13CN
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Detection of HCN and isotopes together with additionnal lines to put results into context.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Assuming the minimun thershold for TOO observations (Comet with Q/Delta >= 2e29) the faintest line we aim at is HC15N with an integrated line flux of 15mJykm/s in a 2km/s line width. We require a sensitivity of 1.5mJy in 2km/s channel to reach a reasonable signal to noise ratio of 5 in 1h on source.
The estimations are made assuming a rather compact configuration C43-2 which creates a flux loss of 30% due to short spacing filtering. More compact configuration corresponds to higher SNR ratio, more extended to slightly lower values.
As we observe very narrow lines, we ask for a small channel spacing. When possible we plan to use only a fraction of the baseband to reduce the data rate. We reach a value close to 12MB/s.
\hline HCN & $2\times10^{26}$ & 4--3 & 354.505 & 1.67 & 3h & 560 & 0.0015 \\ HC$^{15}$N & $1.4\times10^{24}$ & 4--3 & 344.200 & 0.015 & 3h & 5 & 0.0015 \\ H$^{13}$CN & $2.2\times10^{26}$ & 4--3 & 345.340 & 0.023 & 3h & 8 & 0.0015 \\ HC$_3$N & $6\times10^{25}$ & 38--37 & 345.609 & 0.004 & 3h & 1.5 & 0.0015 \\ & & 39--38 & 354.697 & 0.003 & 3h & 1 & 0.0015 \\ CS & $1.5\times10^{26}$ & 7--6 & 342.883 & 0.133 & 3h & 44 & 0.0015 \\ CO & $1\times10^{28}$ & 3--2 & 345.796 & 0.077 & 3h & 26 & 0.0015 \\ CH$_3$OH & $5\times10^{27}$ & $13_1-12_0A^{-+}$ & 342.730 & 0.052 & 3h & 17 & 0.0015 \\ CH$_3$OH & $5\times10^{27}$ & $5_4-6_3A$ & 346.203 & 0.020 & 3h & 7 & 0.0015 \\ \hline

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: DCN-C34S-C33S
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Detection oh DCN and CS isotopes

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Assuming the minimun thershold for TOO observations (Comet with Q/Delta >= 2e29) the faintest line we aim at is C33S with an integrated line flux of 6mJykm/s in a 2km/s line width. We require a sensitivity of 1.1mJy in 2km/s channel to reach a reasonable signal to noise ratio of 3 in 2h on source. All numbers in the table below.
The estimations are made assuming a rather compact configuration C43-2 which creates a flux loss of 30% due to short spacing filtering. More compact configuration corresponds to higher SNR ratio, more extended to slightly lower values.
As we observe very narrow lines, we ask for a small channel spacing. When possible we plan to use only a fraction of the basebands to reduce the data rate. We reach a value not too much above 12MB/s.
DCN & $2\times10^{24}$ & 4--3 & 289.645 & 0.014 & 4h & 6 & 0.0011 \\ C$^{34}$S & $3\times10^{25}$ & 6--5 & 289.209 & 0.028 & 4h & 13 & 0.0011 \\ C$^{33}$S & $1.2\times10^{24}$ & 6--5 & 291.486 & 0.006 & 4h & 3 & 0.0011 \\ HC$_3$N & $2\times10^{26}$ & 32--31 & 291.068 & 0.040 & 4h & 15 & 0.0013 \\ CH$_3$OH & $25\times10^{27}$ & $6_0-5_0E$ & 289.939 & 1.00 & 4h & 380 & 0.0013 \\ CH$_3$OH & $25\times10^{27}$ & $6_{-1}-5_{-1}E$ & 290.070 & 1.14 & 4h & 440 & 0.0013 \\ CH$_3$OH & $25\times10^{27}$ & $6_0-5_0A^{++}$ & 290.111 & 1.30 & 4h & 500 & 0.0013 \\ CH$_3$OH & $25\times10^{27}$ & $6_{+1}-5_{+1}E$ & 290.249 & 0.86 & 4h & 330 & 0.0013 \\

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Comets provide a record of the chemistry of the primitive solar nebula, and thereby important clues on the early evolution of the Solar Nebula. Isotopic ratios are important diagnostics because isotopic fractionation is very sensitive to chemical and physical conditions. This proposal is aimed at exploring the diversity of the HDO/H$_2$O and HC14N/HC15N ratios in comets to understand deuterium and 15N enrichments in primitive Solar System objects. The target will be the most active comets of the Cycle 2 period that matches the $Figure of Merit$ criterion $FoM = Q_{H_2O}/\Delta > 2\times10^{29}$ molec./s/AU. If a comet matches $FoM > 10$, then the study will be complemented by the measurement of the DCN/HCN, C32S/C34S and C33S/C34S ratios with unprecedented sensitivity. Other molecules will be observed to characterize the composition of the comet, study the coma morphology and map the gas temperature distribution.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:previousProposals: 2012.1.00411 (PI Nicolas Biver) The origin of cometary matter: nitriles and isotopes in comet C/2011 L4 (PanSTARRS) was attributed the highest priority but could not be observed due to several weather and technical problems in the observing window (Early 2013)
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Circumstellar disks, exoplanets and the solar system
